description.narrative:
Denmark and Indonesia has cooperated on improvement of the environment in Indonesia since 2005 with first phase total budget of 100 million DKK until 2007. The second phase of the Environmental Support Programme (2008-2012) has a total budget of 220 million DKK and was supporting environmental capacity building in the public sector, Energy Efficiency and sustainable poverty reduction development through improved local environmental management. The main purpose of the environmental support to Indonesia is to support Government of Indonesia¿s efforts in incorporating environmental concern as a substantial element in safeguarding a sustainable economic development and poverty reduction.
ONLY ACITIVITY LEFT AND ONGOING IN 2014 IS THE SEA OF MP3EI (see below):
The Environmental Support Program ESP2 consist of: 1. Support to Public Sector Institutions. To ensure building of knowledge and capacities on a national level for support of decentralized and cross sectoral environmental administration. Under this component, only the finalization of the enormous SEA on MP3EI (national economic acceleration and development plan) exists.
2. Energy Efficiency in Construction and Use of Large Buildings. Support energy efficiency in the private and public sector. Component 2 completed fully in 2013.
3. Support to Decentralised Natural Resources Management and Renewable Energy. Support sustainable and poverty reduction development on Sumatra and Sulawesi through support for sustainable energy efficiency and improved natural administration. Component 3 completed fully in 2013.
